file_content.text: Leave me to my research. I have much work to do.
You have the brain at last! Excellent work. I trust it wasn't too much trouble?
I punished the foul creature for the trouble it caused you.
I made it pay.
My apprentice Malora could learn from your example. She's much too soft-hearted.
The creature was hardly a match for my power.
No trouble at all.
Of course. After all, you're an expression of the dark side's will, too.
What a battle.
Yes, I would imagine so. Just look at the size of that specimen.
You're not getting all the gory details.
Don't bother asking.
Keeping the secrets of your success to yourself? As you wish.
You've done good work, my alien friend. Take your reward and run along.
I must continue my research at once. Great discoveries await. Take your reward and go.
I enjoyed this.
Don't forget who helped you to achieve this victory.
Remember my name.
Don't forget who helped you achieve this victory.
Remember my name.
Don't forget who helped you achieve this victory.
Remember my name.
You might want to consider bathing sometime.
You stink worse than ever.
Yes, yes--you may stop talking now. Goodbye.
I'm running out of patience. Have you finally acquired the mutant tuk'ata brain, or should I send someone else?
Here's the brain.
Ah, ha! Wonderful! Let me see it.
Your beast died much too easily.
That tuk'ata was a pushover.
Then I release you back to the killing fields. May you find greater fulfillment there.
Remember those who aided your research, my lord.
Don't forget who helped you.
When I bestow my wisdom to the entire Empire, you will share some miniscule fraction of my glory.
It's in perfect condition.
Look at the mottling along the frontal lobe. I can't wait to analyze this.
Hope you don't mind if the brain got a little scrambled.
The brain is a bit messy.
I don't need it to be in pristine condition. Half the fun of my work is poking through the layers.
You've done an impressive job, young alien. I have no qualms about rewarding your effort.
You've done me a great service, but now I must continue my research. If there's nothing else....
Just my fee.
Yes, of course. Take your payment, and leave me to my work.
Goodbye, Lord Renning.
I can find you a heart or liver if you need one.
Always happy to help.
This slaughterhouse of yours gives me the creeps.
I can't wait to leave.
Go now, young acolyte. May the dark side make you forever strong....
Malora asked me to sabotage your experiment.
Malora is a traitor.
Is that so? Malora, if you can't show my work the appreciation it deserves, there's no place for you as my apprentice.
Wait, master. It's a lie! I haven't betrayed you.
I know the truth when I hear it, Malora. I'm releasing you from my service... eventually.
Aah! Master, please! Stop! No! Aah!
My dear, the pain for you is only beginning. Take your reward and leave. Malora and I have much to discuss.
You should reward me for exposing this traitor.
I deserve a bonus.
Eliminating an enemy of the Sith Empire is its own reward. Go now.
Let me help interrogate her.
I appreciate your kind offer, but I prefer to handle this myself. Farewell.
Show her some mercy. She doesn't have to die.
Don't kill her.
Oh, there are worse things than death. Goodbye, young one.
Patience, my lord. You'll have it soon.
Give me more time.
Don't bother me again until you have that brain!
I'm still waiting for that brain....
My apprentice Malora is standing over there. Ask her where to find the mutant tuk'ata that escaped.
Ah! I'd heard we were evaluating alien competency to be Sith. How fascinating to finally meet a test subject.
Come closer, apprentice. Don't be afraid to examine my research.
A fresh young acolyte, come to view my experiments? Good.
I trust the sight of a messy operating table doesn't disturb you.
I have no fear of dead things.
Not even a little.
All fine and good--but lack of fear and genuine interest are not the same.
The path to power is not for the fainthearted.
Nothing disturbs me.
Heh. You remind me of myself at your age.
What are you doing?
Understanding the Force's mysteries requires that we seek answers everywhere--even inside a beast itself.
Your lab looks like the inside of a beast's belly.
How disgusting.
So quick to turn away in disgust? You're denying yourself knowledge and power.
This used to be a tuk'ata--the hound-like creatures infesting Korriban's tombs. On the surface, nothing special.
But I alone can see this creature is an expression of pure dark side energy--aggression made manifest.
Amazing. How did you learn that?
I'm impressed.
The Force told me so. It speaks to me.
If you're the only one who can see, maybe it isn't there.
I doubt that.
The ignorant often question the perceptions of the wise. You require enlightenment.
Quite an egomaniac, eh?
I have gazed into the depths of the abyss and found revelations there others only dream of.
The Force is alive. It expresses its will in the physical world. This tuk'ata was one such form.
Are we another of these "forms"?
What does that make us?
Sith are the highest manifestation of the Force's will.
The Force is no more alive than your beast.
I disagree.
Your eyes are shut to possibilities. Open them!
Find a new hobby.
You judge me, yet have no understanding of my work.
I've dissected hundreds of tuk'ata, forging a direct connection to the dark side. Each beast I examine advances me toward perfect unity.
I now stand at a new frontier but find myself thwarted. My most perfect specimen--a tuk'ata mutant--escaped to the tombs before I could analyze it.
Your work is too important to fail, my lord.
That's terrible news.
Indeed. Perhaps the Force has brought you to me for a reason.
Perhaps I could help recover your specimen.
Can I assist?
Yes. I was hoping as much.
Oh, well.
You don't understand. I've lost a vital key to unlocking the dark side's true essence.
You're familiar with those areas from your trials. You could find this tuk'ata for me and retrieve its perfect brain.
You acolytes delve those tombs on your trials. You could hunt that tuk'ata for me and retrieve its perfect brain.
My apprentice Malora saw which tomb the mutant beast fled into. Find out what she knows, assist me, and you will be rewarded.
I'll speak with Malora and do whatever is necessary, my lord.
As you wish.
You've found a great calling in my service. I trust you appreciate that.
Why not send your apprentice to recover this beast?
Can't Malora go?
She is more suited to the laboratory than the tombs. She lacks your fire, I'm afraid.
Sorry, not interested.
Are you quite sure? You're passing up a golden opportunity to advance your knowledge of the Sith arts.
Oh, all right.
Fair enough. It can't hurt to keep my eyes open.
I'll see what I can do.
Ask Malora where to seek the tuk'ata and return to me when you have its brain.
Sorry, but I don't work for psychos.
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
Then get out of my lab.
I'm engaged in delicate experiments. If you seek my wisdom, return at a more opportune time.
You are not Sith. Get out of my lab!
Hello, my little alien friend. It's good to see you still thriving despite yourself!
My dear girl. It's Lord Renning. How wonderful you're still alive!
My dear boy. It's Lord Renning. You thrive, I hope?
I have completed a series of experiments based on that tuk'ata brain you retrieved. Fascinating stuff.
Excellent news, Lord Renning.
I'm glad to hear that.
Brain? Huh?
How quickly the young forget! No matter.
I do love killing things.
Yes, delightful, isn't it? But I can't get distracted with such things just now.
I've sent a gift to be delivered. Just a small token of my esteem but perhaps it will lessen the rather high chances of you being killed.
Farewell, young Sith.
